column1: Art Institute of Chicago////My favorite was sitting for a while in front of Seurat's "A Sunday Afternoon on the Island of La Grande Jatte."  It was seriously a spiritual experience.  Seurat took two years to paint his ten-foot-wide masterpiece
column2: in his self-made style of pointillism
column3: which is the use of small dots of primary colored paint expertly applied near each other to appear as secondary colors from a certain distance.  It's the artistic version of LCD
